meanings.definition: Serving to expel or drive out
meanings.sent1: The loud alarm was expulsive, making everyone leave the building quickly.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind expulsively blew away the fallen leaves from the yard.
meanings.sent3: The expulsive sneeze startled the cat, causing it to jump.
meanings.sent4: Her words were expulsive, pushing him away emotionally.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's expulsive tone silenced the noisy classroom instantly.

meanings.definition: Tending to expel or drive out
meanings.sent1: The medicine had an expulsive effect on the cough, making it easier to breathe.
meanings.sent2: The guard dog had an expulsive nature, always barking at strangers.
meanings.sent3: The expulsive behavior of the vacuum cleaner scared the curious kitten.
meanings.sent4: His expulsive personality made it hard for others to get close to him.
meanings.sent5: The expulsive force of the water hose cleaned the muddy driveway effectively.

meanings.definition: Capable of expelling or driving out
meanings.sent1: The new cleaner was expulsive, removing stains effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The repellent spray was expulsive, keeping insects away from the picnic.
meanings.sent3: The expulsive power of the rocket amazed the spectators at the launch.
meanings.sent4: Her expulsive decision to quit her job surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The expulsive energy of the volcano shook the entire island.
